-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | A parallel evaluation strategy for boxed vectors
--   
--   A parallel evaluation strategy for boxed vectors
@package vector-strategies
@version 0.4

module Data.Vector.Strategies

-- | Evaluate the elements of a boxed vector in parallel.
--   
--   The vector will be divided up into chunks of length less than or equal
--   to the provided chunk size (first argument) and each chunk of elements
--   will be sparked off for evaluation.
--   
--   Use this along with the <a>parallel</a> package's <a>using</a>
--   function:
--   
--   <pre>
--   vec `<a>using</a>` (<a>parVector</a> chunkSize)
--   </pre>
--   
--   <a>parVector</a> can not provide any benefits (read: no parallelism)
--   for unboxed vectors!
parVector :: Vector v a => NFData a => Int -> Strategy (v a)

-- | A class of types that can be fully evaluated.
class NFData a

-- | Evaluate a value using the given <a>Strategy</a>.
--   
--   <pre>
--   x `using` s = runEval (s x)
--   </pre>
using :: a -> Strategy a -> a
